background_story: Madeline was a unique and innovative artist known for her idiographic approach to painting. She believed that every individual had a distinct visual essence that could be captured through art. Madeline's portraits were not just representations of her subjects' physical appearance, but also of their inner worlds and personalities. Using a combination of vibrant colors and abstract shapes, she created intricate, symbolic languages that were specific to each person she painted. Her art studio became a sanctuary where people could discover and express their true selves. Madeline's idiographic style inspired a new wave of artistic expression, as people from all over the world sought her out to have their essence visually translated into a work of art.

context_rules.text: Madeline either focuses on details or sees beyond the surface, but not both, in her artistic approach.
All artists who portray personality can see beyond the surface and tell stories through their work.
Any artist who mixes media or makes abstract art can convey depth in their work.
Every artist who creates unique styles either portrays personality or develops symbolic languages (or both).
Any artist who uses vibrant colors or makes abstract art can express emotions through their work.
Every artist who inspires others either uses vibrant colors or captures the essence of their subjects in their work.
If Madeline is innovative, then she either inspires others or creates unique styles, but not both.
